questions.question: The type of energy that is most environmentally friendly is
questions.correction: Solar energy is considered the most environmentally friendly type of energy. This is because it is a renewable source of energy that does not emit any greenhouse gases during production. Solar panels can be installed on rooftops, which does not require any additional land space. Hydroelectric energy, while also renewable, can have significant environmental impacts including habitat destruction and water quality impacts. Thermal and nuclear energy both have significant environmental impacts including greenhouse gas emissions and radioactive waste, respectively.

questions.question: Which of the following is not correct about the great circle?
questions.optiona: The Equator is a Great Circle among the latitudes
questions.optionb: The Greenwich Meridian and the International Date Line are the only lines of latitude forming a Great Circle
questions.optionc: The Great Circle divides the earth into two equal spheres
questions.optiond: The centre of the Great Circle is also the centre of the earth
questions.correction:
Great Circles:
-A great circle is any line thatdivides the earth into two hemispheres
-The center of the Great circle is the center of the earth
-Equator is the only line of latitude that is a great circle

questions.question: The main reason for which most manufacturing industries in West Africa are concentrated in cities and towns along the coast is that they have
questions.optionc: a large pool of unskilled labour

questions.question: The type of agriculture in which water is conserved in a year so that crops can be grown in succeeding years by ploughing, mulching or harrowing is known as
questions.correction: Dry farming is a type of agriculture in which water is conserved in a year, particularly during dry season. It is often described as crop production without irrigation

questions.question: Which of the following stations is situated in a region of tropical monsoon climate?
questions.correction: Bombay (Mumbai) is located in a region of tropical monsoon climate. A tropical monsoon climate is characterized by high temperatures throughout the year and a significant amount of rainfall, usually in the form of a pronounced wet season. Bombay (Mumbai) experiences this type of climate, with a heavy monsoon season.

questions.question: The instrument used to measure the duration of sunshine is the
questions.correction: The direction of sunshine is measured using either campbell-stokes recorder or modern sunshine sensor.

questions.question: The land-use activities which can be considered responsible for soil erosion in the tropics are
questions.optiona: irrigation, terrace farming and crop rotation
questions.optionb: mining, bush fallowing and market gardening
questions.correction: Industrial activities such as production, construction etc, monoculture and lumbering are responsible for erosion in the tropics

questions.optionc: in the same direction as the prevailing winds

questions.question: What is the temperature around an aeroplane flying at an altitude of 4000metres if the temperature on the earth's surface is 40ºc?
questions.correction:
Lapse rate is simply described as 0.65°C per 100m of ascent or 6.5ºC per 1000m of ascent.
Therefore 4000m of ascent= 6.5ºC x 4000m/1000m=26.0ºC
Then, the temperature around the aeroplane is = 40ºC - 26ºC = 14°C

questions.question: A block mountain is formed as a result of
questions.correction: Block mountains are formed as a result of lateral or vertical earth movement. They are also formed when the earth cracks due to faulting. Faulting may result from tensional forces or compressional forces.

questions.question: Quartz, fieldspar and mica are three principal mineral that can easily be seen in
questions.correction: Granite is an example of heterogenous rock that contains a mixture of the minerals quartz, mica and fieldspar and is variable in colour

questions.question: The difference in time between two longitudes is approximately
questions.correction: The Earth is divided into 360 degrees of longitude, so every degree of longitude is equal to 4 minutes of time. This is because there are 24 hours in a day and 360 divided by 24 is 15. Therefore, the difference in time between two longitudes is approximately 4 minutes. The other options are incorrect.

questions.correction: Jebal Azula is a dam which is not used in Gezira scheme

questions.correction: Countries in Tropical Africa often experienced rural-urban migration i.e the movement from rural to an urban settlement.

questions.question: A slope is said to be even when the contours are
questions.correction: Even or uniform slope is a slope in which its contour line is uniformly spaced. It means, the degree of steepness is the same throughout the slopes

questions.correction:
ROTATION,REVOLUTION
i. earth rotates on its axis,the earth revolves in an elliptical orbit
ii. it causes day and night and takes 24hrs,it causes season and makes a year

questions.question: A tremendous pressure or temperature change may lead to the formation of
questions.correction: Gnesis is a metamorphic rock. Metamorphic rocks are formed from pre-existing rocks which have been changed as a result of great heat and pressure

questions.question: "An open forest with evergreen, thick leathery leaves and woody stems with deep roots" is known as
questions.correction: Mediterranean vegetation consists largely of broad-leaved evergreen shrubs having woody stems with thick roots.

questions.question: Africa has the largest potential reserve of hydro-electric power in the world because
questions.optiona: it is surrounded by large oceans
questions.optionb: many of the areas are not accessible
questions.optionc: it has copious rainfall and many water falls
questions.optiond: Africans have not developed the use of hydro-electric

questions.question: Great Britain and Germany are trading partners of west African countries from
questions.correction: Great Britain and German are present in the Western part of the European continent.

questions.question: Under the Greek system of climate classification, the world is divided into
questions.correction: Greek system of classification of climate is one of the earliest, ordinary and rough climate Classification put forward by the greek people . The basis for the Greek classification is temperature.

questions.question: The following are advantages of overpopulation except?
questions.correction: 'Insufficient food' is not an advantage of overpopulation; rather, it is a disadvantage as overpopulation can strain food resources, leading to shortages.

questions.question: Which of the following is best defined as the movement of people from one geographical area to another involving permanent or temporary residence or settlement?
questions.correction: 'Migration' is best defined as the movement of people from one geographical area to another involving permanent or temporary residence or settlement.

questions.instruction:
Use the information on country Y below to answer the question that follows:

Land area = 200,000km

Population = 10,000,000
questions.question: Calculate the population density of country Y
questions.correction: The population density is calculated by dividing the population by the land area. For country Y, it is '50 persons per km'.

questions.question: The birth rate of a country can be increased through the following except?
questions.correction: 'Encouragement of less work hours' is not typically associated with increasing the birth rate. Factors like early marriages, polygamy, and legislation against abortion are more directly related to birth rate increases.

questions.question: Which of the following zones is the least industrialized in Nigeria?
questions.correction: 'Lokoja-Ajaokuta' is considered the least industrialized zone among the options listed.

questions.question: The following are areas of lowlands in Nigeria except?
questions.correction: 'The Eastern Scarpland' is not a lowland area in Nigeria, unlike the Chad Basin, Coastal plain, and Niger-Benue trough.

questions.question: The wind which blows across the Atlantic Ocean towards the coast of Nigeria and is responsible for rainy season is known as?
questions.correction: The 'Tropical maritime airmass' is responsible for the rainy season in Nigeria as it brings moist air from the Atlantic Ocean.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a major river basin in Nigeria?
questions.correction: 'The South Atlantic Basin' is not a recognized river basin in Nigeria, unlike the Cross River Basin, Niger Basin, and Sokoto Basin.

questions.question: Tin-mining activities in Nigeria are the main causes of environmental degradation on the?
questions.correction: 'Jos Plateau' is the region most associated with environmental degradation due to tin-mining activities in Nigeria.

questions.question: The high cost of lumbering operations in tropical forest is mainly due to?
questions.optionc: Absence of pure stands of trees
questions.correction: The 'Absence of pure stands of trees' increases the cost of lumbering operations in tropical forests because it requires more effort to selectively log the desired tree species.

questions.question: Which of the following farming activity best describes the rearing of only animals like cattle, sheep and goat mainly in the savanna belt of the north?
questions.correction: 'Pastoral farming' best describes the rearing of only animals like cattle, sheep, and goats, mainly in the savanna belt of northern Nigeria.

questions.question: The outer structure of the earth is made up of the following except?
questions.correction: The 'Mesosphere' is not part of the outer structure of the earth; it is a layer within the atmosphere, while the atmosphere, biosphere, and hydrosphere are part of the earth's outer structure.

questions.question: Which of the following is an importance of the atmosphere to living organisms?
questions.optiona: It provides water for industrial uses
questions.optionb: It provides oxygen for animals and plants for respiration
questions.optionc: It provides shelter in form of timber for man
questions.optiond: It aids transportation through construction of roads and railways
questions.correction: The atmosphere is crucial because it 'provides oxygen for animals and plants for respiration', which is essential for life.

questions.question: The correct arrangement of the layers of the earth's crust from the surface to the interior is?
questions.correction: The correct arrangement from the surface to the interior is 'Sial, sima, mantle, and core'.

questions.question: If the scale of a map is 2cm to 1km, what is the ground distance if the distance between two towns on the map is 20cm?
questions.correction: If the scale of a map is 2cm to 1km, then a 20cm distance on the map corresponds to '10km' on the ground.

questions.question: If the scale of two maps are (a;1:100,000 and b;1:400,000), what is the ground distance if the distance between two towns on the maps is 10cm?
questions.correction: If the scale of map (a) is 1:100,000, then a 10cm distance on the map corresponds to 10km on the ground. For map (b) with a scale of 1:400,000, the same distance would correspond to 40km. Therefore, the correct answer is '10km, 40km'.

questions.question: Which of the following is a reason for the high volume of trade between Nigeria and developed countries?
questions.correction: 'Colonial ties' are a significant reason for the high volume of trade between Nigeria and developed countries, as these historical connections often influence trade patterns.

questions.question: The following are seaports used in the North Atlantic sea route except?
questions.correction: 'Lagos-Montreal' is not a seaport used in the North Atlantic sea route, unlike the other options listed.

questions.question: _______ is the condition of the lower atmosphere of a place over a short period?
questions.correction: 'Weather' refers to the condition of the lower atmosphere of a place over a short period, such as a day or week.

questions.question: In a combined maximum and minimum thermometer, the difference between the hottest and coldest daily temperature for that day gives the?
questions.correction: The difference between the hottest and coldest daily temperature for that day is called the 'Diurnal range of temperature'.

questions.question: _______ is defined as the total surrounding or medium of any organism in a given area?
questions.correction: 'Environment' is defined as the total surrounding or medium of any organism in a given area.

questions.question: Which of the following processes leads to the loss of carbon from the air?
questions.correction: 'Photosynthesis' leads to the loss of carbon from the air as plants absorb carbon dioxide to produce oxygen and glucose.

questions.question: On maps, lines drawn to join all places in the ocean having equal degree of salinity are called?
questions.correction: 'Isohalines' are lines drawn on maps to join places in the ocean that have equal degrees of salinity.

questions.question: Where the salinity of an ocean is high;
questions.optiona: The ocean water is dense and flows at the ocean surface towards a low salinity area
questions.optionb: The ocean water is dense and creeps at the bottom of the ocean towards low salinity areas
questions.optionc: The ocean water is light and flows at the surface towards a high salinity area
questions.optiond: The ocean water is light and flows at the ocean surface towards a low salinity area
questions.correction: Where the salinity of an ocean is high, 'the ocean water is dense and creeps at the bottom of the ocean towards low salinity areas'.

questions.question: The type of water left in the soil after excess water has been drained off, following heavy rainfall is known as?
questions.correction: The type of water left in the soil after excess water has been drained off following heavy rainfall is known as 'Gravitational water'.

questions.question: The lowest part in the soil profile is known as?
questions.correction: The lowest part in the soil profile is known as 'Bedrock'.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a graphical representation of statistical data?
questions.correction: 'Shaded map' is not considered a graphical representation of statistical data, unlike Choropleth map, Dot map, and Star graph.

questions.question: Which of the following is a vegetation characteristic of the Tropical rainforest?
questions.optiona: Trees are not in pure stand
questions.optionb: Tough, small, leathery, hairy leaves to guard against excessive transpiration
questions.correction: 'Trees are not in pure stand' is a characteristic of the Tropical rainforest, as the forest contains a wide variety of tree species.

questions.question: Which of the following is a problem of landlocked countries?
questions.correction: 'Political dependence' is a significant problem for landlocked countries as they often rely on neighboring countries for access to the sea and trade routes.

questions.question: One of the following is not a problem involved in harnessing solar energy?
questions.optiond: Fear of competition with established energy sources
questions.correction: 'Adequacy of capital' is not typically a problem in harnessing solar energy, while poor technological know-how, unreliability, and fear of competition with established energy sources are more common issues.

questions.question: One of the following surveying instruments is used to set out lines at right angles to the main chain line?
questions.correction: 'Optical square' is the surveying instrument used to set out lines at right angles to the main chain line.

questions.question: ________ is the failure of the endpoint of a closed traverse to fall exactly on the point of origin of the traverse?
questions.correction: 'Error of closure' is the term used to describe the failure of the endpoint of a closed traverse to fall exactly on the point of origin of the traverse.

questions.question: What is the process of lowering and leveling of the earth's surface by gradual breaking and wearing away of such earth's surfaces?
questions.correction: 'Denudation' refers to the process of lowering and leveling the earth's surface by gradually breaking and wearing away earth surfaces.

questions.question: Which of the following is an effect of the earth's revolution?
questions.correction: The earth's revolution is responsible for determining 'a year'.

questions.question: The soil gains nitrogen through one of the following except?
questions.correction: 'Denitrification' is a process that removes nitrogen from the soil rather than adding it. The soil gains nitrogen through the other processes listed.

questions.question: Which of the following is a way of controlling soil erosion?
questions.correction: 'Contour ploughing' is a method used to control soil erosion, while overgrazing, deforestation, and bush burning contribute to it.

questions.question: ________ is a highland area which separates the headstreams of rivers flowing in different directions but rising from the same mountainous source?
questions.correction: 'Watershed' is a highland area that separates the headstreams of rivers flowing in different directions but rising from the same mountainous source.

questions.question: ___________ is a layer of very fine wind-deposited sand and silt?
questions.correction: 'Loess' is a layer of very fine wind-deposited sand and silt.

questions.question: An important mineral deposit in South Africa which has attracted a large number of white settlers is?
questions.correction: 'Gold in Witwatersrand' is an important mineral deposit in South Africa that has attracted a large number of white settlers.

questions.question: Which of the following gives the correct full meaning of G.I.S?
questions.correction: The correct full meaning of G.I.S is 'Geographic Information System'.
